tournament.name: Thursday 4th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production and uses cards like Aether Gust and Shatter the Sky to deal with threats on the board. Ultimately, the goal is to grind out the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana quickly with Fires of Invention and using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck has a heavy focus on card advantage and manipulation with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. Additionally, the deck includes a lot of board wipes like Shatter the Sky to control the battlefield. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, provides additional value by allowing for more flicker effects and card draw.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to play powerful creatures and spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by overwhelming the opponent with threats. It also includes Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion to provide additional value and synergy with the deck's creatures. The deck includes a mix of ramp, removal, card draw, and finishers like Embercleave and Quartzwood Crasher to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate adds additional value and card advantage to the deck.

The deck focuses on creating a fast-paced aggressive strategy by using creatures like Woe Strider, Whisper Squad, and Gutterbones in combination with sacrifice outlets like Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil. The goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently while controlling the board with cards like Claim the Firstborn. Obosh, the Preypiercer serves as a powerful companion that enhances the deck's overall damage output. Overall, the key concept revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and sacrifice synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of control spells and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Casualties of War. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value by blinking key permanents for additional control and value. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through attrition.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also utilizing powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Cavalier of Thorns to pressure the opponent. With access to powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, the deck can generate incremental advantages over time and eventually overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy.

The concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish control over the game through counterspells, removal, card advantage, and strong threats like Agent of Treachery and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent while maintaining a stable board presence. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra ETB effects. With a versatile toolkit of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shark Typhoon, the deck excels at controlling the game and grinding out victories.

The deck focuses on utilizing a high number of control cards and board wipes to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the opponent's options and maximize card advantage. With a companion like Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage and outvalue the opponent over the course of a game. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for powerful spells and effects.

This deck relies on utilizing Fires of Invention to cheat out powerful spells and control the board. It focuses on ramping up mana quickly through Fires of Invention and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to bring out large threats like Agent of Treachery. Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler help control the opponent's resources while cards like Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon provide board control and card advantage. The deck also includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility in longer games.

The deck revolves around a powerful control strategy that utilizes the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. It focuses on controlling the board with cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Deafening Clarion, and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also utilizing powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to close out the game. The deck also features card draw and selection with Sphinx of Foresight and Castle Vantress to ensure consistency in its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm and out-value opponents in a slower, more controlling manner.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to establish board control and card advantage through powerful planeswalkers and controlling spells. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion, while also generating value with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through its blinking effect. Overall, the deck is built to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can win with powerful threats like Sarkhan the Masterless and Agent of Treachery.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and dealing damage to the opponent quickly using low-cost creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Cauldron Familiar. The key concept involves generating value from sacrificing creatures with cards like Mayhem Devil and Witch's Oven to control the board and put pressure on the opponent's life total. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be used as a companion to further support this strategy by recurring key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient resource management.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrificing effects to deal damage and gain value. Key cards include Mayhem Devil and Cauldron Familiar for consistent pings of damage, Claim the Firstborn for stealing opponent's creatures, and Heraldic Banner for buffing your own creatures. The deck is designed to maintain a steady flow of creatures and damage while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with planeswalkers and enchantments. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion for extra value and synergy with the deck's cards that can be flickered. The win condition comes from resolving powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon, while using Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue and outgrind opponents through resource management and careful decision-making.
